insn_text: Stop taking these herbal products, nutritional supplements: Echinacea, Ephedra, Feverfew, Garlic, Ginger, Ginkgo biloba, Ginseng, Kava Kava, Saw palmetto, St. John''s West, Fish oil, Vitamin B
Stop taking all medicines containing aspirin: Aspirin, Anacin, Ascriptin, Pepto-Bismol, Bufferin, Alka-Seltzer, Excedrin, Florinal, Lortab ASA

stop taking Non-Steroidal Anti-inflammatory Drugs (NSAIDs): Ibuprofen (Advil Motrin, Nuprin, Medipren), Naproxen (Aleve, Anaprox, Naprosyn), Diclofenac (Cataflam, Voltaren, Arthrotec), Celebrex, Toradol (ketorolac), Lodine (etodolac), Feldene (piroxicam), Relefeo (nuburnetce)
Stop taking Accutane
Stop taking Suboxone

conditions: If you take Cialis (tadalafil), Viagra (sildenafil) or Levitra (Vardenafil)
insn_text: Stop taking Cialis, Viagra, and Levitra)
Stop blood thinner warfarin (Coumadin); Might need to switch to Lovenox (enoxaparin) temporarily

Stop the following blood thinning medicines: Plavix (Clopidogrel), Xarelto (Rivaroxaban), Ticlid (Ticlopidine), Pletal (Cilostazol), Brilinta (Ticagrelor), Effient (prasugrel), Aggrenox (Aspirin-Dipridarrola)
Do not eat or drink anything after midnight (no water, coffee, gum, lifesavers, ice, food, etc.)

conditions: If you take meds for diabetes
insn_text: Get instructions from prescribing doctor
Do not drink any alcoholic beverages or smoke 24 hours prior to surgery
In the morning, do not eat or drink anything
In the morning, take all meds with a sip of water at your usual times (except diabetes meds)
In the morning, do not take insulin unless directed by prescribing doctor
In the morning, do not take any medicine that is a water pill (diuretic); includes furosemide (Lasix), hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ), and medicines combined with hydrochlorothiazide (HCT)
In the morning, bring the following to the hospital: inhalers, CPAP mask, eye drops, list of medicines
In the morning, wear loose, comfortable clothing
In the morning, do not wear jewelry, wedding bands, body piercings, makeup, nail polish, artificial nails
In the morning, do not wear contact lenses
In the morning, do not bring valuables to the hospital
In the morning, be prepared to spend a full day at the hospital
An adult will need to pick you up after surgery
